page.title: 08SELBY THE SWING BRIDGE
page.content: THE RIVER OUSE WHICH IS TIDAL AT SELBY RUNS THROUGH THE CENTRE OF THE TOWN. THE MAIN ROAD FROM DONCASTER TO YORK ,THE A19 PASSES THROUGH THE TOWN AND CROSSES THE RIVER ON AN OLD TOLL BRIDGE WHICH SWINGS OPEN TO ALLOW SHIPPING TO PASS.ON AVERAGE THREE BOATS A DAY USE THE RIVER AT THIS POINT AND THE BRIDGE WHICH IS STEEL AND WOODEN IN CONSTRUCTION HAS TO SWING SIX TIMES A DAY. THE BRIDGE IS VERY OLD AND NEEDS CONSTANT REPAIR IN ORDER TO WORK.VERY OFTEN THE BRIDGE STICKS OPEN AND CUTS THE ROAD BETWEEN SELBY AND YORK.SOMETIMES THIS TAKES HOURS TO REPAIR AND A LONG DIVERSION AROUND CAWOOD IS NEEDED.TRAFFIC JAMS BUILD UP AND THE TOWN IS THROWN INTO CHAOS. THERE IS TALK OF BUILDING A NEW BRIDGE THAT IS HIGH ENOUGH TO ALLOW SHIPPING THROUGH.
